summary: The group discussed their initial ideas about the features that they wanted to integrate into the design. They discussed making a universal remote with a locator function. They also discussed the shape and the number of functions in the main interface. The Project Manager instructed the Marketing Expert to examine competitors' remotes, the User Interface Designer to research possible shapes and colors, and the Industrial Designer to research possible materials and the necessary internal components of the device.
actions: The Marketing Expert will examine the features and design of competitors' remotes. The User Interface Designer will research possible shapes and colors for the device. The Industrial Designer will research possible materials and the necessary internal components of the device.

1:
Look at pre-existing models
Reuse the essential components
Incorporate new innovations
2:
Let’s look inside a (simple) remote control
Link to dissected RC
Remote control has parts:
Outer casing:
Board: printed circuits, contact switches
Processor: integrated circuit (TA11835 chip)
Amplifier: op-amp transistor
Transmitter: Infrared LED bulb
3:
Our products can be delivered in different cases. The general case is uncurved (flat). A more original case is single curved or even double curved. 
Furthermore we offer case material supplements, such as plastic, rubber (such as used in anti-RSI stress balls), wood, and titanium (which we also use in our production of space designs). Unfortunately, we can't use the titanium for the double curved cases and latex cases won't allow the use of solar cells as energy source.
4: As energy source we offer a basic battery or, more ingenious, a hand dynamo (like you’d find in 50-year-old torches), a kinetic provision of energy (such as in some modern watches that you shake casually to provide energy), or use of solar cells.
5: For the interface, we are experts on push buttons. In the last decade we have also developed scroll wheels with optional integrated push button (such as in the modern computer mouse), and liquid crystal displays (LCD). Multiple scroll buttons are possible. Note that, if you use a rubber double curved case, you must use rubber push buttons.
6: For the interface, we are experts on push buttons. In the last decade we have also developed scroll wheels with optional integrated push button (such as in the modern computer mouse), and liquid crystal displays (LCD). Multiple scroll buttons are possible. Note that, if you use a rubber double curved case, you must use rubber push buttons.
7:
For the electronics, we can use a simple, a regular or an advanced chip on print. The chip on print includes an infrared sender. Furthermore we have just developed a sample sensor/ sample speaker. 
Note that a push button requires a simple chip, but a scroll wheel requires minimally a regular chip, which is in a higher price range. The display requires an advanced chip, which in turn is more expensive than the regular chip.
8:
Requires a microphone (cheap)
Requires a speech recognition architecture condensed to IC technology.  Tradeoffs involve quality vs. complexity.
For TV noise cancellation: requires an additional microphone and transmission signal to ASR component.

1:
User requirements
Trends
Marketing Strategy of the company
Methodology includes not only the recent remote control market survey but has also considered the latest  fashion trends of the market.
2:
Executive Summary 
Recent investigation of the remote control market shows the following: 
- The most important aspect for remote controls happens to be a fancy look-and-feel, instead of the current functional look-and-feel. This aspect is twice as important as the second aspect. 
- The second most important aspect is that a remote control should be technological innovative. In turn, this aspect is twice as important as the next aspect. 
- The third most important aspect is that the remote control should be easy-to-use.
3:
Recent Fashion Update 
Fashion watchers in Paris and Milan have detected the following trends: 
- This year, fruit & vegetables will be the most important theme for cloths, shoes, and furniture.
- Also in contrast to last year, the feel of material is expected to be spongy.

1:
Asked 100 people what the thought about remote controls…
We got a lot of complaints as there were open end questions
We got some good reactions to specific questions
2:
Bad
Remotes are often lost (50%)
Most buttons are not even used (50%)
Takes too long to master (34%), etc.
Good
Most people between the age of 15-25 would love to have voice recognition. And want fancy pretty remotes.
3:
Voice recognition exists already and is available as open source so there is no need to spend huge amounts in R&D. Yes it is sketchy at times but this is limited vocabulary.
Kill 3 proverbial birds.
People will buy it but is it practical and will they return it? What about visit\fors and training.

Remote Control Unit Design Report









		









Design method



The general design was carried out over four phases by four staff

Project manager Brian

Industrial Designer Arlo

User Interface designer Helen

Marketing manager Raj



At each stage the project manager chaired the meetings and took notes for the minutes

 

  

Phase 1 was the functional design. This consisted of: 

 

User Requirements Specification: what needs and desires are to be fulfilled 

Control Television

Be easy to use 

Technical Functions design: what effect the apparatus should have 

Control TV settings

Working design: how the apparatus works to fulfill its functions 

Simple electronic board, LED

  



Phase 2 was the conceptual design. This consisted of: 

  

Conceptual specification of components, properties and materials

Conceptual specification of user interface  

Trend watching  

  

Phase 3 is called the detailed design. This consisted of: 

Look-and-feel design 

User interface design 



Phase 4 Product Evaluation 

 At the end of each phase the minutes and presentations were produced and placed in the project documents folder.
